summary: Nott saves Yeza and tells her who she really is and He accepts her as she is, the love is in the air at this point,What could...
question: Nott saves Yeza and tells her who she really is and He accepts her as she is, the love is in the air at this point,What could make it more perfect? the M9 start putting the Romantic atmosphere ( most of the ideas are Jester's) making light illusions and stuff like that. At the end they Kiss and the M9 are all cheerful and happy for them
answer:
i tweaked minor illusion a leetil bit to make this work

When Nott spills her story, she expects him to recoil in disgust. To shout and yell, to tell her she should’ve died. (to sound like the thought in her head) Instead, Yeza gently puts his hands on her shoulders. Tells her how, no matter what form she’s in, she’s his wife. That nothing, nothing could stop him from loving her. That, if getting her halfling body back will make her happy, he’ll do everything in his power to help, but he loves her no matter what she looks like.

    And then, he takes her hands in his. Leans forward, slowly, and kisses her.

    Jester seizes the moment. She nudges Caleb, while casting thaumaturgy to fill the room with the sound of gently chirping birds. Caleb casts dancing lights, directing the globules to hover around the ceiling, filling the room with a soft glow. Fjord takes the hint, and casts minor illusion, and pastel rose petals start to fall from the ceiling like snow.

    The pair separate, and Nott notices the change in surroundings, her face darkening with a blush, that only deepens when the group starts clapping and whistling. “Idiots,” she grumbles, reluctantly smiling. Yeza beams at her, and pulls her back into a hug.

summary: Question, if the Mighty Nein played D&D, what do you think they'd have for their characters?
question: Question, if the Mighty Nein played D&D, what do you think they'd have for their characters?
answer:
HMM well I think Fjord would probably stick with the charisma based casting, so I get Sorcerer vibes from him.

Jester might like to try Barbarian. She’d be the cutest little ball of rage smashing shit with a smile on her face.

I feel like Caleb really thinks all the shit Beau can do is really cool, and tbh if he could get a break from Magic that might be good for him so maybe Monk? Maybe one that still uses a little magic since he’s just such a Wizard at heart

Yasha might be a Druid since she could just make as many flowers as she wanted D:

Nott might be an Artificer which would be a cool extrapolation of her skills

Beau is just such a Quintessential Monk… she might like being a fighter? Maybe an eldritch knight so she can do cool magic shit but with a SWORD HELL YEAH

Maybe Paladin for Caduceus because DAMN I could see him taking a Holy Oath VERY seriously and I wanna see Caduceus smite some undead is that a crime

Didn’t Caleb say that high level wizards can tell if someone is seeing through their familiar???? Which is why he didn’t give Frumpkin to Beau and Cad?????

the plot thickens, my friends.

blog.name: crtranscript
blog.title: Critical Role Transcript
blog.description: A #Critter project to add captions to every episode of Critical Role.

summary: SAM: You definitely get to unscrew the gas cap of his car. TRAVIS: Yes, there you go. MARISHA: Shouldn't be proud of that, you...
body:
SAM: You definitely get to unscrew the gas cap of his car.

TRAVIS: Yes, there you go.

MARISHA: Shouldn’t be proud of that, you shouldn’t.

BLAIR: How do you put gas in your car, everyone? How does that work for you?

MATT: He has a man who does that for him.

TRAVIS: “Sir!” There is that button on the side of the gas station that says “ring for attendants.”

BLAIR: Sam has been walking everywhere since the second week he owned a car when he was sixteen because he has not figured out.

MATT: “Sir, can you feed my car?”

SAM: What are these gas stations you speak of? I’ve gone to gas valets, where you just sit there and wait and eventually someone comes out who will fill you up, to get rid of you.

MARISHA: Because you’re blocking traffic to the gas pump.

[laughter]

[laughter]

blog.name: fisherrend
blog.title: DnD Creations
blog.description: Self-taught creative mind from Sweden. There is nothing I love more than to draw, write and make shit up. Here you will find maps, characters, races, monsters, original characters, fan characters and other bits and pieces made, drawn or written by me. All homebrew content is available for public use; just don't claim it as your own. Please do share though if you use anything I've made, I'd love to showcase your creations!

tags: also i want to rewatch the whitestone arc
summary: Inherited Darkness
title: Inherited Darkness
body:
“There is a cold to her eyes,” Trailing off into silence, the sentence withered halfway through. Guilt rose from the words he’d swallowed. Momentary regret. A father shouldn’t anticipate such darkness from his child. And to admit it to their mother.. The guilt kept rising, searing into his chest. The intense lack of sound was deafening. Even scorn would be welcome. Anything to break the void. Anything to kill his intuition.

Yet there was nothing. Only the subtle breathing of his wife. Her eyes, he could feel them on him. His own gaze felt heavy, unable to redirect from the door. It was the one that led down to his old workshop. The workshop, and their youngest child.

“You’ve tried, darling.” Warm words, spoken with hope to soothe. Moving around to block his view of the door, her fingers gently ran through the white hair of her husband. “Pelor knows you’ve tried. We both have.” The corner of her mouth twitched with a hint of a smile as she sought his gaze. “But she’s as persistent as you and me combined. She’s going to keep tinkering.”

Finally he could bear to look at her, losing himself for but a moment in those dark eyes of hers. For a sigh of time, his concerns faded. Heaving a sigh of his own, he slowly shook his head while adjusting the gold-trim glasses, closing his eyes to a passing thought. “I’m just.. Concerned.”

“I know. But she’s not going to waste away in that old workshop. We won’t let that happen.” Lifting his chin up to make him look at her, she was caught off guard by the depth of sorrow in his eyes. There was pain there, pain she hadn’t seen in a long time. Pain of past deeds.

“Wasting away isn’t what I fear for her, dear.” He couldn’t help but glance beyond the dark locks of his love and over to the locked door. This little girl of theirs was brilliant. Creative. Talented. Driven. Ambitious. As a father, he should be proud. But how could he be, when he looks at her, and sees only himself. “My fear is that she’s thriving.”

blog.name: concept-stage

AO3 I'm open for fic prompts.
she/her, You can call me Denni,
I live blog Critical Role every week.
I tag spoilers as 'Critical Role spoilers' until the new episode comes out on youtube.

tags: someone made a post about jester drawkng beau and now i can't find it!
summary: Eye of the Beholder
body:
Eye of the Beholder

Beau snorted as she woke, wiggling her nose and clearing her throat to get rid of the weight of sleep. She sighed and started to lift up her head but paused when Jester’s voice hissed at her from across the room. “No! Don’t move!” She didn’t sound worried, just frustrated.

Beau’s blinked open one eye against the morning sun streaming in through the windows. “Jes-?”

“Don’t move. I’m almost finished, I wanna get the lay of the blankets looking perfectly perfect.”

“Are you- Are you drawing me?”

“You just looked so cute and sleep ruffled, like a sleepy cat, I had to. Now, don’t move. I’ll show you when I’m finished.”

“Alright…” Beau sighed but took the excuse to not get up just yet. She must have drifted back off because she startled awake nearly half an hour later when Jester called out in victory. “Hmm?”

“It’s finished! You can see it now.”

Beau opened her eyes and took stock of the room. Jester was still in her silk night dress, sitting cross legged on her own bed against the far wall. She had her hair pulled up in a bun on top of her head with two colored pencils sticking out of it. She grinned and waved Beau over.

Beau groaned but pushed herself up, throwing her feet out of the bed and letting them hit the ground heavily. She shuffled over and huffed as she dropped onto the bed beside the blue tiefling, resting her chin on her shoulder to look at the book laying open in her lap.

The drawing was immaculate, like the kind you’d see in museums. There was no detail spared, perfect shading, flawless perspective. And it was of Beau drooling on her arm, her mouth hanging open comically with one arm folded awkwardly under her chest. Her hair was still half in-half out of the bun she’d had it in yesterday. There was a yellowing bruise on her cheek bone and a swollen, healing cut on her bottom lip.

“Is that really what I look like when I sleep?” she asked, trying to keep the facial expressions to a minimum so that they couldn’t be misinterpreted. The drawing was perhaps the most beautiful thing she’d ever seen, her problem was just with the subject matter.

“Yep, that’s the beautiful face I see every morning!”

Beau sighed but smiled. “The drawing is beautiful, Jes. Thanks.”

Jester grinned and got to her feet. “I’m going to go show everyone!” Then she made for the door.

Beau tried to reach for her, but she was too sleep heavy to make it in time. “Ah- Hey, Jes, maybe that’s something we can just keep to-” But Jester was gone.

“What the fuck is that?” Nott exclaimed from the next room.

Beau sighed and ran her hand down her face. “Fuck you!” she called back, dropping backwards onto Jester’s bed. At least Jester thought she was beautiful.

summary: I've been drawing DnD characters since Pub draw from Critical role started, and I got the sudden compulsion to draw Nalia,...
body:
I’ve been drawing DnD characters since Pub draw from Critical role started, and I got the sudden compulsion to draw Nalia, @nipuni ’s Elven inquisitor.

I love Nipuni’s work and love Nalia so here is my very obvious copy of one of her drawings to help me learn.

It’s been nice to try to draw a pre-existing character rather than something totally new.
